text: The FDA announced that the CDC's PCR test for COVID-19 failed its full review because it is unable to differentiate between COVID and flu, resulting in the diagnostic tool’s emergency use authorization (EUA) being revoked under a Class 1 recall.
entity_strings: CDC, COVID, COVID-19, EUA, FDA, PCR test, diagnostic tool, emergency use authorization, flu
entities: ['CDC', ' COVID', ' COVID-19', ' EUA', ' FDA', ' PCR test', ' diagnostic tool', ' emergency use authorization', ' flu']

text: CDC will revoke the emergency use authorization of the PCR COVID tests because those tests don't differentiate between COVID and flu viruses. Translation: They've been adding flu cases to Covid cases when using that test.
entity_strings: CDC, COVID, COVID tests, Covid, PCR, emergency use authorization, flu, viruses
entities: ['CDC', ' COVID', ' COVID tests', ' Covid', ' PCR', ' emergency use authorization', ' flu', ' viruses']

text: The CDC is removing its request for emergency use authorisation of PCR tests. This is evidence that PCR tests don’t work, are fraudulent and cannot distinguish between influenza and Covid-19.
The US Food and Drug Administration (FDA) has revoked a PCR Covid-19 test.
A post shared on Facebook claims the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said polymerase chain reaction (PCR) tests do not distinguish between COVID-19 and the flu.
PCR tests can't tell flu from Covid-19
